course.labs.modernartui

Class MoreInformationDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • DialogFragment
      • course.labs.modernartui.MoreInformationDialog

  • public class MoreInformationDialog
extends DialogFragment
    This application contains an (overflow) "options" menu. When the user clicks on that "options" menu an option labeled, "More Information" should appear. When the user clicks on the "More Information" option, the "dialog" (fragment) implemented by "this" class should appear displaying some text and two "buttons". If the user clicks on the "Not Now" button in the "dialog", the "dialog" should be dismissed. If the user clicks on the "Visit MOMA" button, then the "Web Browser" should be opened to view a web page on the "MoMA.org" web site.

    Notes:
    - the app has been tested on the emulator using a "Google Galaxy Nexus AVD - 4.3" with "API" level 18 (screen resolution: 720 x 1280). To limit configuration problems, you should test the app against a similar AVD.
    - keep also in mind that the "Genymotion" Android emulator used. Have a look at:
    https://www.genymotion.com/
    - the project has been created, developed and configured on "Android Studio" IDE. Have a look at:
    http://developer.android.com/tools/studio/index.html
    - screencast video of the app in action can be found at:
    https://youtu.be/bWY8zdC_AvM
    Since:
    2015-06-04
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Aristotelis Metsinis (aristotelis.metsinis@gmail.com)
    See Also:
    http://aristotelis-metsinis.github.io/

    • Method Detail

      • onCreateDialog

        public Dialog onCreateDialog(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        This class extends "DialogFragment", creates and returns a "Dialog" in the "onCreateDialog()" callback method. This method is overridden to build a custom "Dialog" container.
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - The last saved instance state of the "Fragment", or null if this is a freshly created "Fragment".
        Returns:
        Return a new "Dialog" instance to be displayed by the "Fragment".

      • onAttach

        public void onAttach(Activity activity)
              throws java.lang.ClassCastException
        Called when the "fragment" is first attached to its "activity". The "Fragment.onAttach()" method is overridden to instantiate the "DialogListener" interface.
        Parameters:
        activity - Attached "activity".
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - Exception on error.

      • onStart

        public void onStart()
        Called when the "fragment" is visible to the user. The "DialogFragment.onStart()" method is overridden to set the proper "style" as the dialog's "window animations" to use on showing and hiding the "dialog" (fragment).
